turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: You look so happy -- how long have you been married?

turns.speaker: OLD WOMAN
turns.text: Forty-seven years.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Where did he go?

turns.speaker: OLD WOMAN
turns.text: He's getting my sweater from the car.  I said there was a breeze.  I told him not to go.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: May I ask you a question that might sound strange?

turns.speaker: OLD WOMAN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: Hello, Mr. Parker.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: How are you feeling?

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Confused.  I'm not sure what to do now.  I'm not sure what he wants for me.

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: He wants to reward you... That's why I'm here.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: I mean you've done a great thing. You should be rewarded monetarily.

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: What's your shoe size?

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: What?  Who are you?

turns.speaker: MR. CALDWELL
turns.text: If that ain't fate?... Hi, I'm Dave Caldwell.  I do the copy for the anchor on the evening news down here.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Evening News?

turns.speaker: MR. CALDWELL
turns.text: We did a piece after your story ran in the New York Times.

turns.speaker: MR. CALDWELL
turns.text: I've always wanted a watch like that.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: It's yours.

turns.speaker: MR. CALDWELL
turns.text: No.  I won't take it unless I pay for it... Let's see, that's a pretty nice watch -- I can see that.

turns.speaker: MR. CALDWELL
turns.text: I really want that watch.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: This isn't right.

turns.speaker: MR. CALDWELL
turns.text: This is my only chance to get a watch like that.  It would mean a lot to me and my family.  Please take it.  It really isn't that much.

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: There's a one-drink minimum per show, I hope you saw the sign when you came in. Anyway, they're supposed to tell you.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Yes, I heard, and it's not a problem.

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: What are my choices?

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: Everything's ten dollars, and there's no alcohol.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: No alcohol?

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: No alcohol. You gotta get something else. Everything's ten dollars. What do you want?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: What do you think I should get?

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: Non-alcoholic malt beverage?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: ...Noooo.

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: Orange soda?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: Coffee?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: Sparkling apple cider?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: Water?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Water?

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: One drink minimum per show. Everything's ten dollars. Now... tell me what you want or I'll eighty- six you.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Water.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Hello!

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Are you working?

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Working? What do you mean, working? I'm walking.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Isn't it illegal to drink and drive?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: That's funny.  I wonder if you'll take two hundred and fifty dollars to fuck me?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: That is, if you'll come to my room for an hour, I will give you five hundred dollars.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Maybe you shouldn't stand in the road like that. You're pretty drunk.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: You're pretty drunk.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Not really. My room's not far. The Whole Year Inn. You can drive with me if you want...

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Sarah -- with an H?

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: No -- S.E.R.A.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: I'm sort of curious... if you're willing to pay me two-fifty... not that I mind... I mean, I'm OK with that -- why aren't you staying in a hotel?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: We can go to one if you'd prefer.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: No, this is fine. I was just wondering.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Umm. We can stay in the car for an hour if you want. But I really have to go then. It's your time.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Right, I'll get your door. I tend to fade in and out lately.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: I guess I do too.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: You what?

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: I sometimes fade out.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Oh... well, maybe we better synchronize our spells... or stagger them.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: You were going to get my door.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Mind if I use the bathroom?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Want a drink? I'm having one.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: A shot of tequila, if you can spare it.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Do you want to fuck now?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Maybe another drink first. More tequila?

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: OK... whatever.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: What's the story? Are you too drunk to come?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I don't care about that. There's time left. You can have more money. You can drink all you want. You can talk or listen. Just stay, that's all I want.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: No, I came here to drink... myself... you know...

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: To death?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Yes, that's right.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I cashed in all of my money, paid my AmEx card, gonna sell the car tomorrow.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: How long's it gonna take, for you to drink yourself to death?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I think about four weeks, and I've got enough for about two hundred and fifty to three hundred dollars a day.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Yes... that should do it. What am I? A luxury?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Yeah. And your meter just ran out.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: If I was I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: No, just drunk... but that's OK. Where's your car?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I sold it this morning. I'm going to take cabs from now on in.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Don't run away.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Why should I? I know you're not a cop, so what is it tonight? Another two-fifty to watch you sleep?

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: What's up?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I was looking for you tonight. I don't know if you have a boyfriend...

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: ...or a girlfriend, but if you have some free time... maybe we could have dinner.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Are you serious.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I think you know I'm serious. I'll pay you if you like... but I'd like to see you.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: No, I can't have dinner with you.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: I have to change and take a shower first. If you want to come home and wait.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: We should pick up a bottle of tequila on the way. I owe you one.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: You do?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: This is the home of an angel.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: You OK out there?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Yes. Take your time. I'm fine.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: You OK?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Of course. Wow... you look extremely beautiful.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Thank you. What time is it?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Don't know. My watch went the way of the car.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I'm rambling. I really like you. You make me want to talk... I don't know what time it is.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: I like hearing you talk.  If you feel up to a short walk, there's a place to eat around the corner. All the food in Vegas is terrible so the place doesn't really matter. How does that sound to you?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Do they have drinks?

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: I'm from the East. I went to college, did an arts course. I now live in Vegas. I think of it as home. I came here deliberately to carve out a life. I was in LA before, but I'll come back to that later.  The tough times are behind me now. I can deal with the bad things that happen. There will always be dark characters. But my life is good. It is as I would want it to be. So, why are you a drunk?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Is that really what you want to ask me?

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Well, then I guess this is our first date... or our last. Until now, I wasn't sure it was either.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Very clever.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: First. It's our first. I'm just concerned. So... why are you killing yourself?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Interesting choice of words. I don't remember. I just know that I want to.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Want to kill yourself? Are you saying that you're drinking as a way to kill yourself?

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: It wasn't so important to me. I mean, he never asked me why I was a hooker, and that was impressive. I really liked him. So I decided to just play my part. I mean... it's good to help someone once in a while, it's a bonus to being alive, and that was my plan... to stay alive. I suddenly came to a decision.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: What are you thinking? Are you angry with me?

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Ben, why don't you stay at my place tonight? I mean... look, you're so drunk. I like you. I trust you.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: That's astonishing. Sera, look...

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: I hate to think of you in that cheesy motel. I mean...

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Let's face it, what the fuck are you doing in Las Vegas?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I'm going to move to a smart hotel, tomorrow if it'll make you feel better.  Let's talk about tomorrow. Wanna do something?

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Sure... tonight. Then please stay at my place.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Sera... you know I'm not much good in the sack.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: It's not about sex, Ben. I'll make you up a bed on the sofa. Do it for me. We can talk till late and then sleep till late. As you know, I am my own boss.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: How long have I been here?

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Three nights, two days. When is your rent coming up at the motel?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I don't know.  I'll go and sort it out today. Why don't you come?... We'll find a real room for me. You can pick it out, a tower on the strip.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: There's no reason to blow all your money on a hotel room.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: What I mean is that you should bring your stuff over here. We're spending all this time together... what the fuck!

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Sera...

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Let's face it, Ben, we're having fun here. I've never done so much talking in my life.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Me neither.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: So! Let's dispense with the formalities. I want you here... now!

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Sera you are crazy.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: So... I'm not too concerned with long term plans.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Don't you think you'll get a little bored living with a drunk?

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: That is what I want. Why don't you go and get your stuff?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: You haven't seen the worst of it. These last few days I've been very controlled. I knock things over... I throw up all the time.  Now I feel really good... You're like some kind of antidote that mixes the liquor and keeps me in balance, but that won't last forever. You'll get tired of it really quickly. Believe me.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Don't you like me, Ben?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Don't be silly?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Sera... what you don't understand is...

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: You can never... never... ask me to stop drinking. Do you understand?

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: I do. I really do.  OK. I have to do some shopping alone. You go out for a few drinks and then pick up your things. Don't hurry and I'll be back before you to let you in.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Hi!

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Why don't you go in and sit down. I have some gifts for you.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Right... OK...

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Want a drink? Great nap. Wanna go out tonight?

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Seriously, Ben... I need to keep pretty low-key around here. Maybe next time you could nap this side of the door. That was the landlord.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Ben?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Sera, I love that name... S.E.R.A. Before we proceed onwards, there is something I need to say. OK?

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I've come this far... here I am, in your house. I want you to let me pay the rent for this month. All right?

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Because... it's better for me that way. OK?

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Well... OK...

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Sera... I hope that you understand how I feel about this. First of all, you're welcome to my money. We can buy a couple of cases of liquor and you can have the rest. But I don't think you're talking to me right now about money.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: No?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: No. I think you're talking about you. I'll tell you right now that I'm in love with you... but, be that as it may, I'm not here to force my twisted life into your soul.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: I know that...

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: ...and I'm not here to demand your attention to the point where it changes your life. We know I'm a drunk... but that seems to be all right with you. And I know that you're a hooker. I hope you understand that I'm a person who is totally at ease with this... which is not to say that I'm indifferent or that I don't care... I do... it simply means that I trust and accept your judgement. What I'm saying is... that I hope you understand that I understand.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Thanks, I do understand. I was worried about how that would be... but now I'm not. And you should know that included with the rent here is a complimentary blow job.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Ah, yes... I suppose sooner or later we ought to fuck.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Whatever that means. Open your presents.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Right... the suitcase was clinking. So what did you do with your clothes?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I threw them into the garbage, which was perhaps immoral, but I wanted to come to you clean, so to speak. I thought we could go shopping and pick up a pair of jeans and forty- five pairs of underwear and just throw them out each day.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Nice talk, Ben. Keep drinking. In between the hundred and one proof breath and the occasional drool, some interesting words fall from your mouth.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I'm going to fill it right now.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Do you want to go gambling tonight? We could go out and play for a few hours.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Giving you money makes me want to come.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Then come.  I'm going to change. Watch TV. I'll be half an hour.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: I am planning to go out and do some work.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: When?

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Tomorrow night as a matter of fact.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I like women who wear mismatched earrings.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Well, then... I hope we don't run into any tonight.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: I expect some kind of loyalty here. Just because I fuck for money doesn't give you cause to start picking up women and leaving me looking silly.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: How are you doing?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Very well... umm... I never expected to have to ask you this again... but how did our evening go? I remember getting to the casino... I remember kissing you... that was really nice but everything after that is a blank.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Well -- I was prepared for worse, but it wasn't so bad. We were sitting at the bar, talking about blackjack. You seemed just fine, a little drunker than usual, but nothing really strange, but then your head started to droop and I put my arm on your shoulder and then, wham, you swung you arm at me, and fell backwards off your stool into a cocktail waitress. You smashed everything on her tray, it was a real mess. You kept yelling and yelling.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Oh, and what did you do?

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: I tried to shut you up and help you to your feet but you kept swinging at me -- not like you wanted to hit me, but more just waving me away. Security came and when you saw them you stopped yelling. They wanted to carry you out and dump you on the street, but I talked them into letting me walk you out.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: That's impressive. How did you do that?

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: I told them you were an alcoholic and I would take you home. I also promised that we would never come in there again.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: We?

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: You were OK for a while, so we walked for about a block and then you said you wanted to go home and fuck, but I think even you knew that wasn't going to happen. We got a cab and you asked him to stop at a liquor store, even though I told you that we had plenty at home. In the store you gave the kid a hundred and told him to keep the change. I asked you if you knew it was a hundred. You said you did, so I let you do it. We got here, you fell asleep on the couch and I covered you up and came to bed.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I warned you...  ...but I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Here's my speech...  ...I know this shouldn't be acceptable to me, but it is. Don't ask me why. I sense that your trouble is very big... and I'm scared for you... and so I'm doing what I think you need me to do. Falling down in casinos is little stuff. It doesn't bother me. It has nothing to do with us.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: That's amazing. What are you? Some sort of angel visiting me from one of my drunk fantasies? How can you be so good?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Why don't you go back to sleep. I'll go out and buy us some breakfast.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Be careful.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Very creative. Now we can get you a black bow tie and you can look like one of those casino dealers.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: OK, but remember that they wear it because they have to. I wear it because I want to. That'll make me look different. Let's get a drink.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Your color.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I think you should wear one at a time. One of these... and one of your others. In fact, I was going to buy just one, but I didn't think it would fly... as a gift, I mean.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: What was that all about?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Can we just forget it?

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: I don't understand any of that.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Can we just ignore it?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Please!

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Yes... I'll give you that.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Thank you, Sera.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Do you want me not to go tonight?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: No... we already talked about that.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Maybe I should follow you around and ask one of your tricks what it's like to sleep with you.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: They wouldn't know.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: I'll be back home around three. If you're back by then we can watch TV or something... I guess what I'm saying is... that I hope you are back when I get home. Please be careful.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: You be careful to. I'm going to miss you.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Shall we go away for a couple of days?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Yeah... I'd like that.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Years ago, in LA, I turned a trick on Sunset and Western. The guy was polite and didn't argue about the price. He parked his car and I took him to a house that I had an arrangement with. A fat Mexican woman was watching a TV and I told him to give her the twenty for the room. There were three or four small naked children playing on the floor and we had to step over them to get into the room. The room had a bed and a dresser. He lay on his back on the bed and I put a rubber on him and sucked him for a while until he was hard and then I eased on to him. About twenty minutes later there was a knock on the door and it was the woman saying our time was up. I felt kind of guilty because he hadn't come and I offered to reason with the woman and get another ten minutes, but he said it was all right and began dressing. When we were ready to leave the room he stopped me and... hugged me and kissed me on the cheek. He gave me an extra hundred as a tip and went back to his car. I remember being relieved that I wouldn't have to work again that evening.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Last spring I happened to walk past a house that I had once patronized. There was a cool breeze blowing off the ocean and through the window I could see a bare leg. The girl must have been taking a break between customers. It was a strange moment for me because it reminded me of my mother and despite the fact that I was late for something already I just stayed there, loving the atmosphere of it and my memory and... the reason I'm telling you this epilogue is that I felt that I'd come full circle.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Where was that house? The one in LA, I mean.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Fifth and Mayflower. You know it?

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Yes. One of my friends was there. I wonder if you ever clipped her.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I like it here with you.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Let's stay for a while.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: I've missed the best sun. Why did you have to pawn your watch?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I didn't know I'd ever need it again.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Maybe it's time I moved to a hotel.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: And do what... rot away in a room?  We're not going to talk about that. Fuck you! I will not talk about that. You're staying here. You are not moving to a hotel.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Will you lighten up, please?

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: One thing... one thing... this is one thing you can do for me. I've given you gallons of free will here! You can do this for me.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: There are limits.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Yes... I guess I knew that.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I wanted to see you...

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Oh, Ben... you look so very sick... my love... you're so pale.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: You know I love you... yeah?

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Hey, Brad... how's it going?

turns.speaker: BRAD
turns.text: Hey Ben. There were a couple of guys looking for you.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: What did they look like?

turns.speaker: BRAD
turns.text: Suits. I didn't tell them anything. You know anything about gears?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: How'd this happen?

turns.speaker: BRAD
turns.text: I was going real fast down on the beach and something slipped and everything got jammed up.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: The news is not good, kid. This bit here... see there... it's broken. You need a new  one.

turns.speaker: BRAD
turns.text: How much, do you think?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I don't know. I'll find out though.

turns.speaker: CONVENTIONEER
turns.text: About ready for another drink?

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Yes, that would be great. Are you her for the convention?

turns.speaker: CONVENTIONEER
turns.text: Do I look that obvious? My name's Paul.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: So... are you alone, or are you just using me to make someone else jealous?

turns.speaker: CONVENTIONEER
turns.text: Alone. Alone. I'm here alone.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Where are you staying?

turns.speaker: CONVENTIONEER
turns.text: Right here at the hotel. Why?

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Well... I thought you might be looking for a date.

turns.speaker: CONVENTIONEER
turns.text: A date. What, are you a hooker?  What do you mean a date?  I've got a wife back home. I just came over to talk for a few minutes.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: I'm sorry, I guess I misunderstood.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Please don't raise your voice. I won't bother you about it again.

turns.speaker: CONVENTIONEER
turns.text: Sorry. Look... you seem like a nice girl. I'm just sick of everyone in this town trying to get my money.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: I don't want this. Yuri, please. I really don't want this. You know I don't like to do groups.

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: I want this, Sera. I need this!

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Please, Yuri.

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: You have been lonely?

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: I've been all right.

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: I will keep you safe. We are both older.

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: You have been lonely?

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: I am lonely, Yuri.

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: I'm pleased with you, Sera... how you have moved up in the world. I showed you a glamorous world when I took you off the streets...  and how you repay me.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Where have you been staying?

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: With an old friend.

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: It is, after all, Sera, my money.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Yes, of course. How much do you need?

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: All of it. I need to buy many things... all of it!

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: Where have you been?

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: It was a slow night. I went to a hotel for a few drinks.

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: A full night on the street and this is all?

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Like I said... it was a slow night... I'm sorry. It was hard to score.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Don't hit me.

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: What do you think... you are sixteen years old on Hollywood Boulevard?

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: Yes? What?

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: It's me, Yuri.

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: Have you told anyone that I'm here?

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: Go, Sera.  Go. Stay at home. I will call you tomorrow.

turns.speaker: SERA
turns.text: Yuri... are you...

turns.speaker: YURI
turns.text: Sera... please go.

turns.speaker: ADVISOR
turns.text: Harvard Law School?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: ADVISOR
turns.text: But it's a top three school --

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: I have a 4.0.

turns.speaker: ADVISOR
turns.text: Yes, but your major is Fashion Merchandising. Harvard won't be impressed that you aced "History of Lycra". What are your backups?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: I don't need backups. Harvard is the school I'm going to.

turns.speaker: ADVISOR
turns.text: Well, then. You'll need excellent recommendations from your professors, a heck of an admissions essay and at least a one-seventy-five on your LSATs.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: I once had to judge a Theta Chi Tighty- Whitey contest. Trust me -- I can handle anything.

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: What alibi?

turns.speaker: BROOKE
turns.text: I can't tell you.

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: You understand you're on trial for murder?

turns.speaker: BROOKE
turns.text: I didn't do it! I walked in, saw my husband lying on the floor, bent down to check his heart, screamed my head off and Chutney and Enrique ran inside.

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: Where they saw you standing over the body covered in his blood.

turns.speaker: BROOKE
turns.text: Why would I kill my husband?

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: Insurance? A love affair? Pure unadulterated hatred? Believe me, the DA will come up with plenty of reasons.

turns.speaker: BROOKE
turns.text: I loved him!

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: He was thirty-four years older than you. That doesn't sound so good to a jury.

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: Brooke, I believe you. But a jury is gonna want an alibi.

turns.speaker: BROOKE
turns.text: I can't give you that. And if you put me on the stand, I'll lie.

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: Were you with another man?

turns.speaker: BROOKE
turns.text: Go to hell.

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: I'll take that as a no.

turns.speaker: BROOKE
turns.text: Are we done for today?

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: I believe we are.

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: What're you so happy about? You're on trial for murder.

turns.speaker: BROOKE
turns.text: Get up.

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BROOKE
turns.text: You're fired. I have new representation.

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: BROOKE
turns.text: Is he always such an ass?

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: He's the top defense attorney in the state. Of course he's an ass.

turns.speaker: BROOKE
turns.text: But is he an ass that's gonna win my case?

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: He's an ass that's gonna try.

turns.speaker: BROOKE
turns.text: He thinks I'm guilty, doesn't he?

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: That's not what's important.

turns.speaker: BROOKE
turns.text: To me it is. He doesn't trust me. Why should I trust him?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: I'm a Delta Gamma and I'm a huge fan of yours!

turns.speaker: BROOKE
turns.text: You took my class in LA. You had the best high kick I've ever seen. Are you one of my lawyers?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Sort of.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Are you okay? You look so sad... and so orange.

turns.speaker: BROOKE
turns.text: I'm glad it's you and not Donovan.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: He means well. He's really brilliant and all.

turns.speaker: BROOKE
turns.text: Elle, I can't. You don't understand.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Who could better understand than me?

turns.speaker: BROOKE
turns.text: It's so shameful...

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Whatever it is -- it could save you.

turns.speaker: BROOKE
turns.text: That's just it -- it would ruin me!

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: BROOKE
turns.text: I have made my fortune on my ability to teach women how to perfect their bodies with the Brooke's Butt Buster workout.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: I know! You helped me go from a six to a four!

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: BROOKE
turns.text: I'm a fraud! But it's not like normal people can have this ass! If my fans knew, I'd lose everything. I've already lost my husband. I rather be in jail then lose my reputation!

turns.speaker: BROOKE
turns.text: I'm not having an affair with Enrique -- you know a Delta Gamma would never sleep with a man who wears a thong! I just liked watching him bend over to clean the filter --

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: I believe you! Don't worry.

turns.speaker: BROOKE
turns.text: What's going on?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Enrique's gay. I'm sure of it.

turns.speaker: BROOKE
turns.text: He did leave a Cher tape in the pool house once --

turns.speaker: CHUTNEY
turns.text: I got out of the shower, walked downstairs, saw her standing over my father, and called the police.

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: Did she have a weapon in her hand?

turns.speaker: CHUTNEY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: Was there any reason for you to believe she had discarded a weapon?

turns.speaker: CHUTNEY
turns.text: Uh, yeah, because the bitch shot him.

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: Was there any evidence that Mrs. Windham shot him?

turns.speaker: CHUTNEY
turns.text: His dead body with a bullet in it.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Okay -- Ms. Windham, when you uh arrived back at the house? Was your father there?

turns.speaker: CHUTNEY
turns.text: Not that I saw. But like I said, I went straight upstairs to take a shower.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: And when you came downstairs, what happened?

turns.speaker: CHUTNEY
turns.text: I saw Brooke standing over his body, drenched in his blood.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: But Mrs. Windham didn't have a gun?

turns.speaker: CHUTNEY
turns.text: No, she'd stashed it by then.
